intro: Crotalaria malangensis var. overlaetii, commonly known as the Malayan crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in racemes, and are accompanied by small, leaf-like bracts. The seeds are enclosed in pods that split open when mature, dispersing the seeds by wind or animal contact.
